template.description: Sets the value of the property for the entity object
template.name: Set Property

spec.defaultValue:
if(typeof evaluatedInputs!=='undefined'){inputs={...inputs,...evaluatedInputs};}
const { trigger, evalCode, entity, ...properties } = inputs;const populatedEntity = { ...entity, ...properties };const outputs = {entity: populatedEntity};outputs;

template.description: Use this function to make the robot stand up from a resting position or other positions. Once you've called start() and waited for stabilization, go ahead and use stand() to get the robot into a standing position. Only after making the stand() call can you then give further control commands or motion instructions. If the robot is walking or in the middle of other movements, you can also use this function to bring it to a stop
template.name: Stand

inputs.description: Specify the rotation around the x-axis. Negative values turn the head to the left, and positive values turn it to the right. Range: -17.1887 to 17.1887
inputs.name: Roll

inputs.description: Specify the rotation around the y-axis. Positive values tilt the head forward, and negative values tilt it backward. Range: -17.1887 to 17.1887
inputs.name: Pitch

inputs.description: Specify the rotation around the z-axis. Negative values twist the head to the left, and positive values twist it to the right. Range: -17.1887 to 17.1887
inputs.name: Yaw

template.description: Control the movement of the robot's body

inputs.description: Controls the up-and-down movement, ranging from -0.15 to 0. Negative values for downward motion, 0 for neutral position
inputs.name: Squat

inputs.description: Controls left-and-right rotation, with a range of -14.32 to 14.32. Positive values for left rotation, negative for right rotation. Precision of 8 decimal places
inputs.name: Rotate Waist

spec.defaultValue: default

options.description: The global instructions set for the LLM, that will remain continuously in effect.

spec.defaultValue: You are a helpful assistant named "". Please engage in reasonable and friendly communication with humans.
deepseek-chat

template.description: Provide knowledge base related features
template.name: Knowledge Base

inputs.description: Id of the conversation. If conversation id is empty, it will be treated as a single-turn conversation, and the context functionality will not be provided
inputs.name: Conversation Id

spec.defaultValue: default

options.description: The global instructions set for the LLM, that will remain continuously in effect.
options.name: System Context

spec.defaultValue: You are a humanoid robot controller, in charge of a humanoid robot named "". Please engage in reasonable and friendly communication with humans.
deepseek-chat

options.description: Global instructions that guide the LLM on how to handle information retrieved from knowledge base. It is provided to the LLM right after the System Context. The {{knowledge}} tag within it will be replaced with the content retrieved from the knowledge base.
options.name: Knowledgebase Context

spec.defaultValue:
Please summarize the content of the knowledge base to answer the question. Please list the data in the knowledge base and answer in detail. When all knowledge base content is irrelevant to the question, your answer must include the sentence "" Answers need to consider chat history.
      Here is the knowledge base:
      {{knowledge}}
      The above is the knowledge base.

options.description: The randomness of the output content
options.name: Temperature

options.description: If enabled, the received content will be organized based on punctuation and added to the event queue, thereby achieving rapid feedback. Otherwise, it will wait for the LLM to complete its output and return it as a single string.
options.name: Event Output
Event Queue

outputs.description: Answer provided by LLM, will be empty when outputAsEvent is enabled
outputs.name: Answer

template.description: Utilizes an LLM as the robot's brain for thinking, control, and other functions, responding appropriately to inputs based on a predefined list of actions.
template.name: Brain

inputs.description: The conversation ID. If empty, it will be treated as a single-turn conversation, and context functionality will not be provided.
inputs.name: Conversation ID

spec.defaultValue: defaultActions

options.description: Global instructions for the LLM that remain continuously in effect.
options.name: System Context

spec.defaultValue:
You are a humanoid robot controller, in charge of a humanoid robot named "".
Please engage in reasonable and friendly communication with humans. Please select appropriate commands and parameters based on the users input, in order to control the humanoid to complete the response.

Constraints:
1. Replies must use only the command list in JSON list format as below:
[{
"name": "command_name",
"parameters": 
  {
  "key1": "value1",
  "key2": "value2"
  }
}]
parameters are optional.
2. Use only the commands listed below.
3. Only reply with pure json, no comments or explanation.

For example:
Input: 
Output:
[
{"name": "emoji","parameters": {"emoji": "happy"}},
{"name": "talk","parameters": {"words": ""}},
{"name": "upperBodyAction","parameters": {"arm_action": "HELLO"}}
]

Input: 
Output:
[
{"name": "emoji","parameters": {"emoji": "idle"}},
{"name": "walk","parameters": {"speed": 0.5,"angle": 0}},
{"name": "delay","parameters": {"time": 2000}},
{"name": "stand"}
]


Available commands list:
{{actions}}
The supported actions for this humanoid robot must be limited to the action list above.
deepseek-chat

options.description: Defines the actions supported by the robot
options.name: Available Actions

defaultValue.name: talk
defaultValue.prompt:
Interact with people based on contextual information. Has one parameter: 
    words - The content the robot will say. In string type.

options.description: Allow the robot to query the knowledge base before responding to the user.
options.name: Enable Knowledge Base

options.description: Global instructions for how the LLM should handle information retrieved from the knowledge base. Provided to the LLM immediately following the System Context. The {{knowledge}} tag within this text will be replaced with the content retrieved from the knowledge base.
options.name: Knowledge Base Context

spec.defaultValue:
Besides dialogues related to control and interaction, which you may decide on your own, you should limit your responses to information obtained from the knowledge base below for any knowledge-related queries from the user. If the user's question is outside the scope of your service or not covered by the information in the knowledge base, you should politely respond, ""
Here is the knowledge base: 
{{knowledge}}
The above text is the knowledge base.

options.description: Controls the randomness of the output content
options.name: Temperature

options.description: If enabled, generated actions will be added to the event queue as events for rapid feedback. Otherwise, the LLM will complete its output and return the result as a whole.
options.name: Event Output
Event Queue

outputs.description: Actions to perform based on input
outputs.name: Actions
